lines.text: Pretty boy son has a rich daddy, and a good-looking mommy. The uncle knocks off daddy, marries mommy, and he cuts pretty boy out of the action. So junior goes crazy and he kills them all. Not a pretty story... but there it is.
Isn't that the plot to 'The Lion King'?
Guns don't kill people, physics kills people.

[reading Dr. Seuss]
My God, this man is a genius!
I think you look distinguished with gray hair.
Thank you. I think you would look distinguished with gray hair, too.
No. When men get gray hair, they look distinguished. When women get gray hair, they look old.
When women get breasts, they look sexy. When men get breasts, they look old.
Good point!
It was a horrible flight! There was a man on the wing of the plane!
The same thing happened to me!
I want ceaseless joy and never-ending passion like Romeo and Juliet.
They both wound up dead.
Antony and Cleopatra.
Dead.
That couple from Wuthering Heights.
Insane and dead.
F. Scott Fitzgerald and Zelda.
Drunk, insane, and dead.
Tristan and Isolde.
Abgeschossen.
Aha, Siegfried and Roy.
Okay, one.
[Looking at the babies at the nursery]
Which one is it?
It must be him - it's hideous.
Hey, that's my daughter!
I'm so sorry. SHE'S hideous.
Nina, who is this 'Tom' that Mary keeps talking about?
I don't know, and it's none of my business.
It's none of my business and I'm obsessed with it!
That's typical. Why is it that men think that when you plant the flag, you own the mountain.
I spent two years climbing that mountain, and I'm not about to let some guy yodel on it!
Where would we be without the agitators of the world attaching the electrodes of knowledge to the nipples of ignorance?
Isn't there a place where people can have mindless sex with different partners?
Yeah! It's called "the 70s."
Nina, take my car to the garage and rotate my tires.
That's not in my job description.
What is in your job description?
Typing.
Okay, well, type it into your job description and get my tires rotated.
Solomon, climb the rope!
What's at the top of the rope?
Your self-esteem.
My self-esteem?
Now climb the rope or you get to go sit with the girls.
So if I don't climb the rope, I get to go sit with the girls? You're going to have to help me out here, I'm failing to see the downside!
[after drinking household chemicals]
Um, I've lost all feeling in the left side of my body.
[Looks at upside-down can]
Could somebody please call "116"?
Harry, I need you to drive me somewhere.
Nope.
You know I outrank you.
Then, "No, sir!"
[after finding out his father was "the Big Giant Head"]
I don't know who I am anymore!
Well, your first name is Dick, and your last name is Head...
[repeated line]
I'm gorgeous!
I am now the coolest punk in school.
Well, congratulations. What did you do?
I got suspended for setting off the fire alarm.
They suspended you? You saved hundreds of lives!
That's the best part; there was no fire.
Tommy, this is outrageous! The next time you set off the fire alarm, you'd damn well better start a fire first.
[Dick is whining about his job]
You know, Dick, when life gives you lemons, just shut up and eat the damn lemons.
Women. You can't live with 'em, and yet they're everywhere.
I could do it with my eyes closed!
You do everything with your eyes closed!
I want to give mankind the gift... of electricity.
Harry, they already have electricity.
Well! Then my work here is done.
Just be glad you're at the top of the food chain and nothing eats you.
What about the shark in Jaws? He's so scary.
[Harry is looking for a job offer in the newspaper]
Here's a job that I can do. "Police are seeking third gunman." Tomorrow, I'm gonna march over to the police station and show them that I'm the man they're looking for.
So, when can I touch your breasts?
Right before you die!
What happened, Harry?
It came out!
Is it an alien?
Well, it's purple, and it's slimy, and it's got a hose.
A hose?
Oh, great. It's a mutant.
Alright, we'll kidnap him, and hide him, when it's a teenager we'll set him free, and then if it's really messed up, we can blame him on television.
[Marry Albright arrives]
They just brought him to the nursery. He is positively glowing.
Now it's glowing.
Let's go see him. He's got Vicky's eyes.
What's he doing with Vicky's eyes?
I just hope it's not eating them.
Oh, Mary! I've had one of those terrible dreams again! We were getting married!
Oh.
No, that's the good part. Then, my family showed up.
Oh, and they objected?
Well... They had issues.
Don't worry. I wrote a speech in case that happens. Well, it's just two words. One of them's "off".
I'm not finger-pointing...
[points at Mary]
but it's YOUR fault! YOU!
The yelling will cease or the killing will commence!
You think you're the smartest man on the planet, don't you?
For the thousandth time, yes!
Remind me never to ask you for another favor again!
You weren't right for the role.
Hey, how'd the audition go?
I lost the part. The "Di-rec-tor" didn't think I was good enough!
you had delivery, presence, timing, you just didn't have that indefinable something extra.
I was just trying to score some points with my girlfriend, is that too much to ask?
'Romeo & Juliet' is a Shakespearian tragedy, it has nothing to do with a horny teenager and his girlfriend!
You just can't imagine what it feels like, Dick. It's like he reached in... and pulled all the bones out of my body...
[Sally starts crying]
My god, what are you doing?

[Wipes her tears]
Apparently I'm leaking!

This is just perfect. I try to mold us into a family that will blend in, and what do I get? A surly teenager, a sister obsessed with a man, and a brother who drinks too much. Is there another family in the whole world like this? I don't think so!
I find you pompous, judgmental, and completely self-absorbed. Would you be my friend?
Dr. Solomon, I have an answer, but I think it might be wrong.
Why, Leon, of course it's wrong. You'll always be wrong! In fact, the odds of you being right are staggering!

[about her breasts]
Hmm, they seem to have greater power when they collide.
promotions! Sally, you are now *Senior* Security Officer.
That'll look good on the ol' résumé!
Tommy, you are now *Senior* Information Officer.
It's about time!
What about me?
Harry, you are now... Harold.
Champagne for everyone!
Mary is too old for you.
I'm older than you.
Well, then, you're too old for her. Either way, it won't work.
I make her laugh, Dick. She likes it.
You shut your foul mouth!
Hey world, I'm alive. And these pants are washable.
Excuse me, we've been driving around for hours. Do you know of any hotels that have rooms?
I believe that *all* hotels have rooms.

[reading the Bible]
Wow, these people begat their brains out!
[around Super Bowl season]
Tell me what you've done to Sally. Where are you taking her?
I can't. I wish I could.
Can't you give me a hint?
All right... We're going to do something on the weekend... in San Diego.
Why can't you give me hint?
We're going to do something on Sunday... in San Diego.
Just one clue?
We're going to something on SUNDAY... in SAN DIEGO... at a STADIUM.
Just one tiny clue?
The Super Bowl, Harry!
WORK WITH ME, BABY! WHICH SUPER BOWL?
Don't listen to him, he's just a kid.
Oh, don't worry. I used to be a kid myself... a long time ago.
[laughs]
Say there, sport, you like girls?
Yeah. Sorry.
Your son is impossible.
And you're a pain in the ass, you're made for each other.
[Dick is locked in an invisible box and feels the walls]
Oh no! He's turned me into a mime!
[Harry is dressed as an alien for Halloween]
Oh, Harry. You're an alien.
[Harry screams]
NO, I'M NOT! I mean, yes I am.
[Dick goes to a Halloween party as a pirate]
Ahoy, matey. Where are your buccaneers?
Under my buckin' hat.
Hey, buy us a couple of beers?
Sure.
[Hands Sally and Nina two beers]
So, you girls going to the big game?
We don't want to talk to you. We're just broke.
[Takes beers and leaves]
Have a little compassion, Sally, we're healthy. We have to help him.
I say he's lame. Shoot him.
Oh, how exciting. I am SO glad I get to be the woman. Next planet I get to be something BIG... WITH HORNS!
I don't envy you at having to take care of three men. I only got Frank and he's a full-time job. Just once, I'd like to see that man pick up a sock.
I'd like to see men put their dirty dishes in the sink.
I'd like to see them do laundry.
I'd like to see them crammed between two steel wheels and ground into a fine paste.
You know, I'd like to see that myself.
You let me know.
Lieutenant!
Yes, sir!
This planet has crossed the line. Assemble the giant robot.
Just act normal.
I'd ask you to do the same, but I'm afraid that ship has sailed.

[eyes closed]
Sally, I can't see behind my eyelids.
Open them.

[opens his eyes]
Ohhh, they're manual...
Holy cow, we weren't just dating leggy babes...
We were dating leggy babes from beyond!
Our home for this mission was Earth, a third-rate planet. I got a third-rate car, a job at a third-rate university and now we were looking at a third-floor apartment.

[pointing to the sky]
I've been there. I've been there. And there. And there.
The long, boring stories you must have!
So what are you in here for?
The police think I'm crazy because I told them I was from the planet Circon 9.
Do you know Steve?

[Dr. Albright is being pursued by another man]
I have... a plan!
Remember, Dick, you're not allowed to disintegrate Earthlings.

[pause]
I have... *another* plan!
Sally, I think you're only attracted to my uniform! Do you know what this means?
Yeah...
It means you'll never see me out of uniform again!
Dr. Albright, have I been a perfect ass?
Aw, nobody's perfect.
Haven't you come to your senses yet?
I will never come to my senses!
How dare you use your flesh to tempt me?
Well, that's what it's there for!
It's like watching Entertainment Tonight in Carnegie Frickin' Hall!
Mary, there's something I have to tell you. I come from another world.
And that's news?
[Dick has entered the office wearing a tight-fitting construction worker's outfit and a tool belt]
Whaddaya think, Nina? Ya like beefcake?
Not from your funky bakery.
[winks]
Dubcek's threatening to make me work it off, and I don't think she's talking about mowing the lawn.
[Repeated line]
Incoming message from the Big Giant Head!
You want the truth? You want the truth? Well, I can't handle the truth!
[at career day]
Sorry I'm late, kids, but I was just involved in one of the world's scariest police chases.
How did it end?
The guy got away.
[dejected groans]
but, I rolled my car!
[cheers]
I don't mean to panic anyone, but I'm afraid the calamari has been infested with baby squid.
Who needs Christmas anyway? I say "Bug Humbar".
Talk to the hand.
YOU!
[Points at man by bar]
Your sexual organs are in total diometric opposition to mine!
Well... hey! So, can I give you a call sometime?
Hey, check out the bartender.

[sarcastically]
Ooh... God's gift to women.
I hope he kept the receipt.
This is the bake sale committee, right?
Yes, I don't believe I've seen you before.
I don't believe you're blonde.
Are these magic brownies?
Pepperidge Farm.
Do you have anything for rope burns?
[to Officer Don]
Well, Don, if I had a gun like that I wouldn't be sitting behind a desk till I ran out of bullets.
[Mary and Dick are in a restaurant]
Mary, the waiter made a mistake. You ordered Surf and Turf. They brought you steak and lobster.
Dick, that's what surf and turf is.
Oh... I thought it was water and grass.
How nice, it's the gift that keeps on sucking.
So tell me, how far away is Cleveland?
An assault charge. The federal court house is there.
Right! Cleveland is a felonious assault away!
My woman won't let me be a woman! Excuse me, I'm going to go draw a bath and then have a fat-free cookie.
[Tommy and Harry are moving Sally's belongings out of the house]
[Tommy carries a large box with difficulty]
Oh, Harry, you've got to help me with this box, it's filled with rocks and books and stuff.
Step aside.
[Harry grips the box and gets ready to push it up, as he does, the box flies over his head]

[giggling]
... It was empty...
[Tommy leaves]
No.
[grabs the box and starts to leave]
I'm the strongest man in the world!
So, Dick. Wanna know what I heard around the water cooler today?... There's a weird guy hanging 'round the water cooler.

[selling chocolate door to door, a priest opens the door]
Hi, father. I'm trying to see these chocolate bars so the high school band can go to Washington... and learn about Christianity... and become priests.
[the priest slams the door in his face]
Fine, then! They'll stay here in Rutherford and worship SATAN!
Incoming message from the Big Giant Head. The Big Giant Head is unable to take your call at this time. You must wait until your call is answered in the order it was recieved.
And my job will be to figure out what causes harm to the human form. Like getting your fingers crushed in a car door. Ow. Ow. Ow. Ow. Ow.
Dick! Sally and Harry wont buy me a beer.
Sally, Harry, don't be so cheap!
Badgers do not suck! They bite!
And I've done some shaving. Somewhere on my body you will discover a tufted heart.
You know, one thing I learned - television always goes better with food.
Actually, Sally, uh, Halloween is revered as the day when the graves yawn and the dead rise.
Plus you get to stick candy corns up your nose.
Do I make myself clear, Tommy?
Oh no, I'm Harry.
No, from now on you will be referred to as Tommy.
Hey, what about me?
You will be Tommy too.
Wait, so Tommy as in the number 2 or as what...?
You will all be known as Tommy!
[the Solomons are blasting "Entertainment Tonight" on their new TV]
How loud do you need to hear that it's Mary Steenburgen's birthday?
The manual said hair below the shoulders but not above the head. I don't think anyone is going to look down there.
So are you glad we tried something new?
Not really, it made me cold... and shrivelly.
What does the crowd look like out there?
Why don't you open up the curtain and look?
Oh, nice breath. What did you have for lunch, garlic?
Well naturally you didn't eat lunch at all so you can chew on the scenery.
Great mastery of theater terms. Did you learn taht you in your book called "How to Perform on Stage?" because maybe you should start with the chapter called "How to Perform on Stage".
Yeah? Well maybe you shouldn't do card tricks that reflect off of your big, bald head!
